com.cjsavage.java.net.discovery

Class ServiceFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cjsavage.java.net.discovery.ServiceFinder

  • public class ServiceFinder
extends Object
    Used to send requests for ServiceAnnouncers to respond to.

    See the package summary for example usage.

    The ServiceFinder can receive responses either by multicast or a TCP socket depending on how it is instantiated. The default constructor will use multicast to receive responses while the ServiceFinder(int) constructor will receive responses on the port number supplied.

    You must call startListening() before calling findServers(String, int).

    Since:
    1.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static interface  ServiceFinder.Listener
      Interface for receiving details of discovered servers and state change events for the ServiceFinder.

      Creates a new ServiceFinder that will listen for responses on a TCP socket listening on the supplied port.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ServiceFinder

        public ServiceFinder()
        Creates a new ServiceFinder that will listen for multicast responses using the default group and port. See the ServiceAnnouncer for the default group and port.

      • ServiceFinder

        public ServiceFinder(int port)
        Creates a new ServiceFinder that will listen for responses on a TCP socket listening on the supplied port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to listen for responses on
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if port is not a valid port number

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(ServiceFinder.Listener listener)
        Adds a listener to receiver server and state change events.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to add

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(ServiceFinder.Listener listener)
        Removes a listener previously added with addListener(com.cjsavage.java.net.discovery.ServiceFinder.Listener).
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener to remove

      • isListening

        public boolean isListening()
        Returns true if this ServiceFinder is currently listening for responses.
        Returns:
        true if this ServiceFinder is currently listening for responses

      • startListening

        public void startListening()
        Starts listening for responses from ServiceAnnouncers. Depending on the constructor used, this ServiceFinder will listen for multicast or TCP responses.

      • stopListening

        public void stopListening()
        Stops listening for responses from ServiceAnnouncers.

      • findServers

        public void findServers(String serviceId,
               int requestId)
        Sends the multicast broadcast asking for servers to announce themselves for the serviceId supplied.

        If the serviceId is longer than 32-characters it is truncated. Found servers can be retrieved by registering a ServiceFinder.Listener.

        Parameters:
        serviceId - the service ID to find
        requestId -
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the service ID contains illegal characters
        IllegalStateException - if this ServiceFinder is not listening for responses

      • setMaxThreads

        public void setMaxThreads(int maxThreads)
        Sets the maximum number of threads that can be spawned to handle TCP responses. Must be > 0.
        Parameters:
        maxThreads - the maximum number of threads that can be spawned

      • setMulticastGroup

        public void setMulticastGroup(InetAddress group)
        Sets the multicast group to use for sending requests.

        This same group is used to receive requests if this is a ServiceFinder was instantiated as a multicast receiver.

        If this ServiceFinder is listening, it will be restarted and the new address used immediately.

        Parameters:
        group - the group to use for sending and receiving requests
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if group is null

      • setMulticastPort

        public void setMulticastPort(int port)
        Sets the multicast port to use for sending requests.

        This same port is used to receive requests if this is a ServiceFinder was instantiated as a multicast receiver.

        If this ServiceFinder is listening, it will be restarted and the new address used immediately.

        Parameters:
        port - the port number to use for sending and receiving requests
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if port is not a valid port number

      • setPrintProtocolErrors

        public void setPrintProtocolErrors(boolean printErrors)
        Sets whether this ServiceFinder should print a line to System.err when it receives a response for a protocol version higher than is supported. Default is false.
        Parameters:
        printErrors - true to print protocol errors to System.err

      • setReceiveBufferSize

        public void setReceiveBufferSize(int size)
        Sets the receive buffer size.

        The default and minimum is 256 bytes which should be plenty under normal circumstances.

        Parameters:
        size - the size of the receive buffer
